abstract.p: Fire breaks out in minimall in Brighton Beach, Brooklyn, gutting building, destroying eight businesses and injuring 25 people (S)

block.p: A fire that broke out in a minimall in Brighton Beach yesterday gutted the building, destroying eight businesses and injuring 25 people, fire officials said.
Three people were treated at Coney Island Hospital for smoke inhalation, said James Spollen, a Fire Department spokesman. Twenty-two firefighters were also treated there for minor injuries, he said.
A fire that broke out in a minimall in Brighton Beach yesterday gutted the building, destroying eight businesses and injuring 25 people, fire officials said.
Three people were treated at Coney Island Hospital for smoke inhalation, said James Spollen, a Fire Department spokesman. Twenty-two firefighters were also treated there for minor injuries, he said.
The fire broke out around 5 p.m. and was under control by 9:30 p.m., Mr. Spollen said.
Mr. Spollen said the fire broke out in a beauty parlor and its cause was under investigation. Other shops in the building included a convenience store and a pharmacy, he said.
